items.title: People 12 and older are now eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine in SF
items.summary: San Francisco to continue equity strategy to ensure residents of hardest-hit neighborhoods receive equitable access to vaccine.

items.title: San Francisco responds to FDA Emergency Use Authorization of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for youth ages 12 to 15
items.summary: On Monday, May 10, the Food and Drug Administration granted Emergency Use Authorization of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for individuals 12 to 15 years old.

items.title: SF to reopen businesses and activities for the State's Yellow Tier
items.summary: Beginning Thursday, May 6, San Francisco will reopen indoor bars, indoor family entertainment activities, outdoor organized community sporting events and indoor saunas and steam rooms, and will loosen guidelines for a range of activities.

items.title: City commissions new mural celebrating the strong family and community bonds helping SF's Latinx community heal
items.summary: Local artist Elizabeth Blancas creates new mural in the Mission’s famed Clarion Alley.

items.title: San Francisco expands network of neighborhood COVID-19 vaccine sites as part of equity strategy
items.summary: This week’s expansion in eligibility to people 16 and older coincides with the opening of the second neighborhood vaccine site in the Mission District in partnership with the Latino Task Force as part of an equity strategy to ensure low-barrier access to vaccines for communities.
